text.section: There is a Maryland Clean Water Fund.

An expenditure that the Department makes under subsection (c)(5) of this section shall be reimbursed to the Department by the sewage sludge utilizer whose sewage sludge utilization brought about the expenditure by:
Endangering public health, safety, or welfare; or
Endangering or damaging natural resources.

In addition to any other legal action authorized by this subtitle, the Attorney General may bring an action against any person who fails to reimburse the Department under subsection (d) of this section to recover any expenditure that the Department makes under subsection (c)(5) of this section.
In determining the use of the Maryland Clean Water Fund, priority shall be given to activities relating to the water quality of the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries.

Notwithstanding any law to the contrary, funds credited and any interest accrued to the Fund:
Shall remain available until expended; and
May not be reverted to the General Fund under any other provision of law.
